verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When either man or woman shall separate themselves to vow a vow of a Nazarite, to separate themselves unto the LORD:
verses.ct: "Tell the Israelites this: When a man or woman wants to make a special vow — the vow of a Nazirite — dedicating themselves to the LORD,

verses.kjv: He shall separate himself from wine and strong drink, and shall drink no vinegar of wine, or vinegar of strong drink, neither shall he drink any liquor of grapes, nor eat moist grapes, or dried.
verses.ct: they must stay away from wine and any other alcoholic drink. They must not drink vinegar made from wine or from any other alcohol. They must not drink grape juice or eat grapes, whether fresh or dried.

verses.kjv: All the days of his separation shall he eat nothing that is made of the vine tree, from the kernels even to the husk.
verses.ct: For the entire time of their dedication, they must not eat anything that comes from the grapevine — not even the seeds or the skins.

verses.kjv: All the days of the vow of his separation there shall no razor come upon his head: until the days be fulfilled, in the which he separateth himself unto the LORD, he shall be holy, and shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow.
verses.ct: During the entire period of their dedication vow, no razor may touch their head. Until the time of their dedication to the LORD is complete, they are set apart as holy and must let their hair grow long.

verses.kjv: All the days that he separateth himself unto the LORD he shall come at no dead body.
verses.ct: During the entire time they are dedicated to the LORD, they must not go near a dead body.

verses.kjv: He shall not make himself unclean for his father, or for his mother, for his brother, or for his sister, when they die: because the consecration of his God is upon his head.
verses.ct: Even if their father, mother, brother, or sister dies, they must not make themselves ceremonially unclean, because the sign of their dedication to God is on their head.

verses.kjv: All the days of his separation he is holy unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Throughout the entire period of their dedication, they are holy to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And if any man die very suddenly by him, and he hath defiled the head of his consecration; then he shall shave his head in the day of his cleansing, on the seventh day shall he shave it.
verses.ct: If someone suddenly dies right next to them, making the hair of their dedication unclean, they must shave their head on the day of their purification — they must shave it on the 7th day.

verses.kjv: And on the eighth day he shall bring two turtles, or two young pigeons, to the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation:
verses.ct: Then on the 8th day, they must bring 2 turtledoves or 2 young pigeons to the priest at the entrance of the tent of meeting.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall offer the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, and make an atonement for him, for that he sinned by the dead, and shall hallow his head that same day.
verses.ct: The priest will sacrifice one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, making atonement for the person because they became unclean through contact with the dead. That same day, the priest will reconsecrate their head.

verses.kjv: And he shall consecrate unto the LORD the days of his separation, and shall bring a lamb of the first year for a trespass offering: but the days that were before shall be lost, because his separation was defiled.
verses.ct: They must rededicate themselves to the LORD for the full period of their separation and bring a 1-year-old male lamb as a guilt offering. The previous days of dedication will not count, because their dedication was made unclean.

verses.kjv: And this is the law of the Nazarite, when the days of his separation are fulfilled: he shall be brought unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation:
verses.ct: This is the instruction for the Nazirite when the period of their dedication is complete: they must be brought to the entrance of the tent of meeting.

verses.kjv: And he shall offer his offering unto the LORD, one he lamb of the first year without blemish for a burnt offering, and one ewe lamb of the first year without blemish for a sin offering, and one ram without blemish for peace offerings,
verses.ct: There they must present their offerings to the LORD: one 1-year-old male lamb without any defect as a burnt offering, one 1-year-old female lamb without any defect as a sin offering, and one ram without any defect as a peace offering.

verses.kjv: And a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, and wafers of unleavened bread anointed with oil, and their meat offering, and their drink offerings.
verses.ct: They must also bring a basket of unleavened bread — loaves of fine flour mixed with oil and unleavened wafers spread with oil — along with the accompanying grain offerings and drink offerings.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall bring them before the LORD, and shall offer his sin offering, and his burnt offering:
verses.ct: The priest will present all of these to the LORD and sacrifice the sin offering and the burnt offering.

verses.kjv: And he shall offer the ram for a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the LORD, with the basket of unleavened bread: the priest shall offer also his meat offering, and his drink offering.
verses.ct: Then the priest will sacrifice the ram as a peace offering to the LORD, along with the basket of unleavened bread. The priest will also present the grain offering and the drink offering.

verses.kjv: And the Nazarite shall shave the head of his separation at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and shall take the hair of the head of his separation, and put it in the fire which is under the sacrifice of the peace offerings.
verses.ct: At the entrance of the tent of meeting, the Nazirite must shave off the hair that symbolized their dedication. They must take that hair and place it in the fire burning under the peace offering sacrifice.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall take the sodden shoulder of the ram, and one unleavened cake out of the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and shall put them upon the hands of the Nazarite, after the hair of his separation is shaven:
verses.ct: After the Nazirite has shaved off the hair of their dedication, the priest will take the boiled shoulder of the ram, one unleavened loaf from the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and place them in the hands of the Nazirite.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before the LORD: this is holy for the priest, with the wave breast and heave shoulder: and after that the Nazarite may drink wine.
verses.ct: The priest will then lift them up as a wave offering in the LORD's presence. This is a holy portion that belongs to the priest, along with the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the contribution. After this, the Nazirite may drink wine again.

verses.kjv: This is the law of the Nazarite who hath vowed, and of his offering unto the LORD for his separation, beside that that his hand shall get: according to the vow which he vowed, so he must do after the law of his separation.
verses.ct: This is the instruction for the Nazirite who makes a vow. Their offering to the LORD for their dedication must follow these requirements, in addition to whatever else they can afford. They must fulfill whatever vow they made, according to the rules of their dedication."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto Aaron and unto his sons, saying, On this wise ye shall bless the children of Israel, saying unto them,
verses.ct: "Tell Aaron and his sons that this is how they should bless the Israelites. Say to them:

verses.kjv: The LORD bless thee, and keep thee:
verses.ct: 'May the LORD bless you and protect you.

verses.kjv: The LORD make his face shine upon thee, and be gracious unto thee:
verses.ct: May the LORD look on you with favor and be gracious to you.

verses.kjv: The LORD lift up his countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.
verses.ct: May the LORD turn his face toward you and give you peace.'

verses.kjv: And they shall put my name upon the children of Israel; and I will bless them.
verses.ct: In this way they will place my name on the Israelites, and I will bless them."
